data.author: Dirk Mika

changelog.release_notes:
Pebble Time ready.
Timer now uses wakeup API to relaunch the app 5 seconds before end if the app was closed while a timer is running.
New color scheme on pebble time ("match watch") which uses a background color matching the watch color as close as possible.

State is saved when app is closed. If a timer was running, it is resumed on restart as if the timer were running in background.
Note: the timer actually doesn't run in background, because this is not possible. So if the time runs out while the app is closed, nothing happens.

data.description: A simple and easy to use Timer application. By pressing select you set minutes and seconds. Press down (start) to start the timer, press down (stop) when the timer is running, to pause. Press up (reset) to reset the timer to it's start-value. Press select long to enter a small setup screen.

latest_release.release_notes:
Pebble Time ready.
Timer now uses wakeup API to relaunch the app 5 seconds before end if the app was closed while a timer is running.
New color scheme on pebble time ("match watch") which uses a background color matching the watch color as close as possible.

data.title: Timer

data.author: iSmoothRun

changelog.release_notes: Support for Pebble Time added.
Added support for pebble time and pebble time round.

New features:
Notification on new split (km/mile) with vibration average pace, average HR and Maximum HR
Notification on new lap or interval with vibration average pace, average HR and Maximum HR
Notification for the upcoming interval (interval number, goal and target) along with the preannouncement, will emit 3 short vibes followed by a long vibe at -3, -2, -1, 0 seconds from interval start

data.description: Unleash your Pebble's potential. Transform it to a real sports watch. Add as many pages you like and any metrics you want. Pace, Speed, HR, Distance, Cadence, Lap stats, Split stats you name it. Start/Stop your run, mark laps without touching your phone. Watchface with your weekly stats. Use the best iPhone app for runners and cyclists and take your training to the next level.

latest_release.release_notes: Support for Pebble Time added.

data.title: iSmoothRun

data.description:
With the Authasas Pebble Companion App it is possible to authenticate to any Authasas protected resource using your Pebble watch.

After entering your username and password on the protected resource you will receive a notification on your Pebble watch from where you can Approve or Reject the authentication.

When manually starting the Authasas Pebble app it will provide a One-Time-Password.

data.author: metroidmen

changelog.release_notes: Few bug fixes. :)
- Further bugfixes for Android device.
- Bug fixes for Android Settings page

- Removed always on backlight.

- Updated to 2.1 SDK

- Squashed some bugs

1.2.1 - Reworked detection system! It should actually detect all of your bulbs and let you control them this time. Sorry about that guys. :P - Menu has been reworked to streamline faster light selection and control! - When opening Huebble it is defaulted to controlling every light on your network, once individual bulbs are selected, you can send the highlighted commands to the selected bulb with select, and by doing a long press on select it will send the request to all bulbs! Makes it much easier to quickly control selected and immediately control every bulb! - If a request is submitted and the lights are off, it will turn them on and to what's requested! (e.g. If they're off and you set to 20% brightness, they'll turn on to 20% without you having to manually tell them to turn on first. Very helpful for waking up in the dark!) - Increased speed of menu scrolling. - Now allows you to exit registration screen a the start of the app without registering rather than getting stuck in a loop and requiring a force quit. - KNOWN ISSUE: You will have to reregister the app with your Hue hub once again at the start, and after doing so the lights menu will not detect the name of your bulbs, this is a one time error associated with initial registration that can be resolved by simply exiting Huebble and reentering again. 1.2.2 - Fix for light name detection to work properly. - App now remembers which lights were selected upon exiting. 1.2.3 - Fixed a critical crash caused when no connection to Hub - Updated the "Send' icon" 1.2.4 - Cleaned up Javascript - Can now push and hold to control all bulbs for Dance Mode - Added splash screen to help with background loading - Tweaked some icons 1.2.5 - Added an always on backlight

data.description:
The first true Philips Hue light controlling app for Pebble! Control the power, the color, and brightness straight from your wrist! Options for Philips presets are present, along with other fun extras included as well!

For any issues, try entering your IP address manually in the settings page!

latest_release.release_notes: Few bug fixes. :)

data.title: Huebble

data.description:
FawzmaGames presents Golfsol.

Golfsol is a fast paced solitaire game based off golf solitaire. 

Move the card select with the top button.

Middle button is used to select the card and put on the bottom row. You need to chain your cards with other cards that are value above or below the previously shown card.

Bottom button adds a card to the pile.

This is a stripped down, free app, means it provides only basic functionality! Buy the companion app "Pebble InfoCenter" offered in google play store. Help with your donation! Support further development. Thanks. :)

data.description: News providers such as n-tv, Stern, BBC, New York Times, NPR, heise, World Street Journal or Le Figaro haven't stepped forward to the pebble jet. In the meantime InfoCenter provides the latest news to you. Also you can configure your own google alerts and feeds. The latest stock values are shown of the DAX, Tec Dax, Dow Jones and/ or e.g. your own configured stock portfolios. Also the latest exchange rates are shown to you. Last but not least weather forcast is provided. Give it a try!

latest_release.release_notes: * maintenance/ bugfix release

This Watchapp is not associated with the Sony Corporation or its subsidiaries.

data.author: Erik de Bruijn

changelog.release_notes: Fixes settings. This version has an updated URL for settings, since settings pages need to be hosted online and Google Pages hosting is discontinued by Google.
Now should work with the new owner-api that Tesla offers instead of the earlier API. Fixed several bugs. iPhone support is still completely untested, but I've successfully used it with Android 5.

Should fix the settings bug for new users and allow you to choose non-european values (USD/mile). Also fixes a login bug.
Also has improved localization.

data.description:
Control your Tesla Model S or X. Start/stop charging, heat/cool your car, you can check in/outdoor temperatures, see your range...

Enter Tesla login on the phone through "Settings".

Initially the app was made for myself but got a life of its own. You can buy me a beer or help me save for my Model 3: https://www.paypal.me/EdeBruijn :)

latest_release.release_notes: Fixes settings. This version has an updated URL for settings, since settings pages need to be hosted online and Google Pages hosting is discontinued by Google.

data.description: Flip a half dollar on your wristwatch by pressing the top button. The app keeps track of how many heads and tails there are. You can reset this to zero at any time. It also shows you your last flip result. The bottom button clears the heads/tails count. The middle button can be used to select four different coins. 1) 1964 JFK cartoon coin 2) 1917 Type 1 Standing Liberty 3) 1916 mercury dime

Does your snoring keep you or your partner awake at night? Does a gentle nudge make you adjust your sleeping position and stop snoring? 

Snore Alarm uses your Pebble smartwatch to provide the 'gentle nudge', and over time intends to modify your sleeping position to reduce or even prevent your snoring.

Each gesture can be linked to launching the apps of your choice via our Android application.

RingMyPhone will turn your volume to max, turn your screen on, and keep ringing until you tell it to stop.

data.author: luchs

changelog.release_notes: Since 2016-12-11, there are two new line colors for S7/S71 and S8/S81. The app now shows the new colors on Pebble Time.

- Fix crashes on original Pebble/Pebble Steel. Unfortunately, there is not enough RAM with the newest Pebble OS. I had to remove one departure line and the tram graphics there to make it work.

 - Also build for Pebble 2. Pebble 2 has the same processor/RAM as Pebble Time, so everything works fine there.
Access the live.kvv.de API via HTTPS. This makes the app work again.

- Add back the status bar on Pebble Time.
 - Change highlight color to red.

Version 2.0: Pebble Time support and new layout

- Routes are colored on Pebble Time.
- New layout using two rows per departure which shows the number of trains and whether the train has a low floor.
- Vibrate when loading proximity stops or departures takes longer than three seconds.
- In-app settings at the bottom of the main menu which allows toggling vibration and the new layout.
- German translation

- Continuously clicking "Search" doesn't crash the app anymore.
- Errors returned by the KVV.Live API are shown on the watch (instead of never ending "Loading...").
- "No connection" will also be shown for the proximity search if the phone isn't connected or the Pebble app isn't running.
New feature: proximity search. Finally, it's possible to search for stations near you directly from the watch app.

- The stop list can now be configured.
 - The stop name doesn't scroll anymore on the departures window.

See the releases page on github for information on previous updates.

data.description:
Shows live departure data from Karlsruhe's public transit (KVV).

Configure your frequented stops on the phone, then view departure information on Pebble.

Data is taken from live.kvv.de

Deutsch

Zeigt Live-Abfahrtsdaten des Karlsruher Verkehrsverbundes (KVV) an.

Zuerst die Ã¼blichen Stationen am Handy einstellen, dann die Abfahrtszeiten auf der Pebble ansehen.

Daten kommen von live.kvv.de

latest_release.release_notes: Since 2016-12-11, there are two new line colors for S7/S71 and S8/S81. The app now shows the new colors on Pebble Time.

data.title: KVV.live
